alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 26 at 2:42PM CDT until May 27 at 4:18PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues in some areas. . * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama, including the following area, Covington. portions of northwest Florida, including the following areas, Escambia Coastal, Escambia Inland, Okaloosa Coastal, Okaloosa Inland, Santa Rosa Coastal and Santa Rosa Inland. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may continue to result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain continues across the watch area, although intensities have decreased and the rain area continues to move east out of the area as well. By early evening the rains will have ended across the watch area. Localized flooding and standing water will remain possible until the rain clears the area due to very saturated soils. Some areas of coastal Escambia and Santa Rosa Counties have received 3 to 6 inches of rain today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
